item.title: Detailed Compliance for Non-Microsoft Antivirus Solutions
item.description: So what happens when you’re not using Windows Defender on your Windows 10 and later Microsoft Intune enrolled devices, and you’re not happy with the basic compliance checks for Third-Party Antivirus products?

item.title: Updating Apple Operating System Compliance Policies
item.description: Apple devices shouldn’t be exempt from Operating System compliance policies, and these policies should share the same fate as Windows ones, and be updated monthly in line with update release cycles.

item.title: Updating Defender Antivirus Compliance Settings
item.description: We’re going to have a look at updating a Microsoft Defender compliance policy with the latest platform update version, automatically.

item.title: Windows Operating System Compliance Updates
item.description: Let’s talk about Windows 10 and above Operating System Compliance in Microsoft Intune, and specifically how using ‘Minimum OS Version’ and ‘Maximum OS Version’ is dumb and you should definitely check yourself if you’re using this in your environment.
